SecuGen.FDxSDKPro

Interface SGFingerPresentEvent


  • public interface SGFingerPresentEvent
    This interface must be implemented by an application that will use the SGAutoOnEventNotifier class to detect finger presence on the SecuGen device. Once the SGAutoOnEventNotifier thread has been started, a finger placement on the attached SecuGen device will cause the host application SGFingerPresentCallback() method to be called.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void SGFingerPresentCallback()
      Method that will be called when the SGAutoOnEventNotifier thread detects a finger.

    • Method Detail

      • SGFingerPresentCallback

        void SGFingerPresentCallback()
        Method that will be called when the SGAutoOnEventNotifier thread detects a finger. It is good practice to call SGAutoOnEventNotifier.stop() immediately upon execution of this method to stop the auto detect thread while local processing by the host application is taking place. SGAutoOnEventNotifier.start() may be called again by the host application to start the auto detect thread.

        Example:

        public class JSGDActivity extends Activity
          implements View.OnClickListener, java.lang.Runnable, SGFingerPresentEvent {

            private SGAutoOnEventNotifier autoOn;

            ...

          public void SGFingerPresentCallback (){
            autoOn.stop();
            fingerDetectedHandler.sendMessage(new Message());
          }
        }
        See Also:
        SGAutoOnEventNotifier
